meanings.definition: To renounce or reject something formally.
meanings.sent1: She was foreswearing all unhealthy snacks to improve her diet.
meanings.sent2: The politician foreswearing any ties to the controversial company.
meanings.sent3: The cat was foreswearing the new brand of cat food with a dramatic meow.
meanings.sent4: He was foreswearing his old ways like shedding a worn-out coat.
meanings.sent5: The student foreswearing distractions to focus on studying for the exam.

meanings.definition: The act of making a solemn promise to give up or abstain from something.
meanings.sent1: His foreswearing of sweets was evident in his dedication to a healthier lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: The community admired her foreswearing of luxuries to help those in need.
meanings.sent3: The foreswearing of desserts led to a comical craving for broccoli ice cream.
meanings.sent4: Her foreswearing of negativity was like a shield against pessimism.
meanings.sent5: The foreswearing of technology during the retreat made it a truly peaceful experience.
